meanings.definition: To stop making progress or to come to a standstill.
meanings.sent1: The car stalled on the road, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent2: The construction work stalled due to bad weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The student's progress in math class stalled when he forgot his calculator.
meanings.sent4: Her career seemed to have stalled, stuck in the same position for years.
meanings.sent5: The engine stalled, leaving the boat stranded in the middle of the lake.

meanings.definition: A situation where progress is halted or delayed.
meanings.sent1: The project faced a stall when key team members left unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The economic growth showed a stall in the last quarter.
meanings.sent3: The market experienced a stall when the new product failed to attract customers.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations hit a stall when neither party could agree on the terms.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam caused a stall in the flow of vehicles on the highway.
